name: Filtered
slogan: Make the world learn better through technology
description:
As automation, AI, and new job models reconfigure the business world, lifelong learning has become an economic imperative. The materials to provide that learning already exist. Our mission is to address the global skills by matching the best of that content with the people that need them. We use proprietary algorithms and human expertise to do that. For the end-users of our product, magpie, it means a feed of high-quality, relevant, impactful learning to make you better at your job and more confident doing it. For companies, we solve many kinds of problems by enhancing the capability of the workforce.

We’re an open, supportive organisation where we respect individuality and help each of our team to tackle and enjoy complex challenges. We care about you and your development.

team.name: Amanda Green
team.bioHtml:
ex-EY Financial Services Audit
Entrepreneur First alum 2018
Finance & Operations at Filtered 
Business & Career Coach

jobs.title: Enterprise Relationship Manager
jobs.description:
### 

### About us

As automation, AI, and new job models reconfigure the business world, lifelong learning has become an [economic imperative](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.economist.com%2Fspecial-report%2F2017%2F01%2F12%2Flifelong-learning-is-becoming-an-economic-imperative). The materials to provide that learning already exist. Our mission is to address the global skills by matching the best of that content with the people that need them. We use [proprietary algorithms](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.filtered.com%2Fthoughts%2Fhow-does-magpie-make-learning-recommendations) and human expertise to do that. For the end-users of our product, [magpie](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fpulse%2Fwhat-magpie-marc-zao-sanders), it means a feed of high-quality, relevant, impactful learning to make you better at your job and more confident doing it. For companies, we solve many kinds of problems by enhancing the capability of the workforce, including [these nine](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.filtered.com%2Fthoughts%2Fnine-problems-we-want-to-talk-about).

 

Try [magpie](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fdemo.gf.filtered.com), read what we [think](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.filtered.com%2Fthoughts).

We’re an open, supportive organisation where we respect individuality and help each of our team to tackle and enjoy complex challenges. We care about you and your development. You can read about our benefits package below.

We care deeply about making Filtered an inclusive and diverse place to work. We encourage applications from all demographics and backgrounds to maximise the capability and neurodiversity of the team. We don’t make decisions based on gender, class, ethnicity, sexual orientation or any other personal characteristics which are unrelated to the role. We understand that everyone has different lifestyles and we accommodate flexible working to make sure you are as productive and happy as you can be.

 
### About you

You will be responsible for driving the sales of magpie to maximise Filtered market share  
  
You’ll report into the Head of Sales as part of the Sales Team  
  
You will use your skills / experience to work with prospects, clients and multiple internal teams to ensure our recommendations technology and methodology is used to solve concrete organisational problems, delivering new business and growing existing accounts.

 
### Key responsibilities

- Ownership of the sales cycle to successfully growing magpie’s client base
- Developing your own book of business, through a combination of your own prospecting (including cold outreach), driving and attending events, leverage of your network and driving warm leads to close
- Tracking personal sales pipeline and monitoring outcomes to create reports and feedback for Senior Management
- Attend relevant industry events to promote the Filtered product, brand and philosophy
- Work with marketing to create sector-specific campaigns, generating effective target data leading to leads

**Requirements**

### Non-technical

- Integrity
- Curiosity
- Client Focus
- Resilience
- Proactivity
- Accuracy
- Information Gathering
 
###   

### Technical

### 

Required

- Build strong relationships quickly
- Manage a 360 sales cycles to maximize magpie direct and partner revenue

- Proven track record (3+ years) of closing B2B £40,000+ (SaaS experience preferred)

Preferred

- Knowledge of the magpie product

**Benefits**

Competitive pay

Private healthcare

Discounted gym membership

Pension

Flexible working

Enhanced maternity and paternity leave

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
NO EXTERNAL RECRUITMENT AGENTS

As automation, AI, and new job models reconfigure the business world, lifelong learning has become an [economic imperative](https://www.economist.com/special-report/2017/01/12/lifelong-learning-is-becoming-an-economic-imperative). The materials to provide that learning already exist. Our mission is to address the global skills by matching the best of that content with the people that need them. We use [proprietary algorithms](https://learn.filtered.com/thoughts/how-does-magpie-make-learning-recommendations) and human expertise to do that. For the end-users of our product, [magpie](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/what-magpie-marc-zao-sanders), it means a feed of high-quality, relevant, impactful learning to make you better at your job and more confident doing it. For companies, we solve many kinds of problems by enhancing the capability of the workforce, including [these nine](https://learn.filtered.com/thoughts/nine-problems-we-want-to-talk-about).

Try [magpie](https://demo.gf.filtered.com), read what we [think](https://learn.filtered.com/thoughts).

We're looking for an experienced product manager to join our team. This is a senior role, and as well as day-to-day product management you'll be expected to get involved more broadly, helping to define product strategy and to establish best practices in product development.

Your role will include:

- Developing a deep understanding of our customers and our business, and using that understanding to define future development of a number of our products.
- Thoroughly researching proposed product ideas. 
- Developing those ideas which show promise, including overseeing the design process.
- Maintaining a development backlog for the products you're responsible for, and providing enough detail for effective development.
- Collaborating with the engineering team throughout the delivery process.
- Overseeing the launch of new product features, validating their effectiveness and using the experience as a source of feedback for future product iterations.

You will also be expected to:

- Support product strategy and longer term roadmapping, including preparation for communicating both of these to stakeholders across the business, Filtered's board, investors and customers.
- Own the implementation of new product tools and practices, for example user testing and analytics frameworks.
- Help define how Filtered approaches product in general.

This role reports in to the Chief Product Officer, and you'll collaborate closely with our existing product and engineering teams, as well as many stakeholders inside and outside the business.

The role is currently fully remote as a result of government policy, but Filtered is based in Shoreditch, London. We're remote friendly at all times.

**Requirements**

We're looking for a particular approach to product management. In particular, we expect that:

- You're customer oriented, and view speaking to customers and understanding them an their needs as key part of the role.
- You'll be hypothesis driven, and take a scientific approach to product development. You view product ideas as hypotheses to be tested rather than simply a list of things to build.
- You're data driven, but also understand the value of more qualitative evidence.
- You're motivated to move quickly, for example, you realise that you can learn from a very basic initial implementation of a product feature, or from user research based on a mock-up. You're not afraid to get involved in the delivery process if that's necessary to help you achieve your goals.
- You're commercially minded, and are comfortable working closely with the sales, marketing and customer success teams.

We don't require any specific qualifications for this role, but it is a senior position, so we expect you to have several years of high quality experience in focused product management roles. Experience working in a start-up, in a B2B environment selling to large enterprises or in the learning and development space would be a strong plus, but it not required.

**Benefits**

As well as a competitive compensation package (based on skills and experience), we also offer flexible working, a generous pension scheme and 25 days holiday per year.
